physical_appearance:The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features four ladies and four children. Six of them are standing up and two of them are sitting down. All of them are looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. They are dressed in theri ethnic costumes and some of them adorn headdresses. A lady in the centre who is sitting down is holding onto a child who is sitting on her lap.

sgcool_label_text:This studio photograph shows a group of four nyonyas and four children posing before a painted backdrop of a Chinese landscape. \r\n\r\nStudios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s
 Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This studio photograph shows a group of four nyonyas and four children posing before a painted backdrop of a Chinese landscape. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
